Uses of Class
LJava.Relation

Uses of Relation in LJava
 

Fields in LJava declared as Relation
static Relation LJ._
          An engine static generated relation which represents any single value.
static Relation LJ.LJavaFalseRelation
          An engine static relation that symbolize False.
static Relation LJ.LJavaTrueRelation
          An engine static relation that symbolize True.
static Relation LJ.nil
          An engine static generated relation which represents any value.
static Relation Variable.none
          Serves as a no-value relation as a value for variables that was instantiated to have no value.
 

Methods in LJava that return Relation
static Relation LJ.nil()
          Returns the static relation nil().
static Relation LJ.relate(java.lang.Object... args)
          Creates a new relation with a blank name and arguments.
static Relation LJ.relate(java.lang.String n, java.lang.Object... args)
          Creates a new relation with a name and arguments.
 Relation Relation.replaceVariables(java.lang.String s)
          Returns a new relation which is exactly as this Relation but replacing all the variables which aren't instantiated.
 

Methods in LJava with parameters of type Relation
static boolean LJ.conduct(Relation r)
          Conducts a full DB scan to find all solution for the given relation.
static boolean LJ.conduct(Relation r, VariableValuesMap varValues)
          Acts just like conduct only it returns the results into a VAriableValuesMap without instantiating any of the variables in the relation.
static boolean LJ.exists(Relation r)
          Runs a giving relation to compare with the engine's database and satisfy any given variables in the given relation if possible.
static boolean LJ.exists(Relation r, VariableValuesMap varValues)
          This method performs as exists only it doesn't instantiate the variables.
static void LJ.nil(Relation r)
          Relates a given relation as an in-order relation, which is represented by a Relation object, into the engine's database.
static void LJ.nilSet(Relation r)
          Relates a given relation as a set relation, which is represented by a Relation object, into the engine's database.
 boolean Relation.relationStructureCompare(Relation r)
          Compare the structure of this relation to a given relation.
